item.title: How to Become a Vibe Coder
item.description: In this episode of Uncanny Valley, WIRED’s senior correspondent Lauren Goode reports back from her brief stint as a vibe coder.

item.title: How to Become a Vibe Coder

item.title: Trump Is Betting Big on Intel. Will the Chips Fall His Way?
item.description: The Trump administration is aiming to take an equity stake in Intel, according to US commerce secretary Howard Lutnick. Experts say the unconventional deal could backfire.

item.description: The Trump administration is aiming to take an equity stake in Intel, according to US commerce secretary Howard Lutnick. Experts say the unconventional deal could backfire.

item.title: Why Did a $10 Billion Startup Let Me Vibe-Code for Them—and Why Did I Love It?
item.description: I spent two days at Notion and saw an industry in upheaval. I also shipped some actual code.

item.title: Decoding Palantir, the Most Mysterious Company in Silicon Valley
item.description: This week on Uncanny Valley, we talk about one of the most notorious American corporations. So what does Palantir actually do?

item.title: Decoding Palantir, the Most Mysterious Company in Silicon Valley

item.title: Lisa Su Runs AMD—and Is Out for Nvidia’s Blood
item.description: While everyone else has been talking about Nvidia’s GPUs, Lisa Su has discreetly turned AMD into a chipmaking phenom. And as the US-China tech war rages, she’s at the center of it all.

item.title: Lisa Su Runs AMD—and Is Out for Nvidia’s Blood
item.description: While everyone else has been talking about Nvidia’s GPUs, Lisa Su has discreetly turned AMD into a chipmaking phenom. And as the US-China tech war rages, she’s at the center of it all.

item.title: A Hiker Was Missing for Nearly a Year—Until an AI System Recognized His Helmet
item.description: Using AI to analyze thousands of frames taken by drone, The Piedmontese Alpine Rescue team has found the body of a doctor who had been missing since September 2024.

item.title: A Hiker Was Missing for Nearly a Year—Until an AI System Recognized His Helmet
item.description: Using AI to analyze thousands of frames taken by drone, The Piedmontese Alpine Rescue team has found the body of a doctor who had been missing since September 2024.

item.title: Programmers Aren’t So Humble Anymore—Maybe Because Nobody Codes in Perl
item.description: Perl is a messy, maddening programming language, the “duct tape of the internet.” But at least you can tell it was made by humans.

item.title: X Data Center Fire in Oregon Started Inside Power Cabinet, Authorities Say
item.description: Generative AI has put data centers under the spotlight, and surging electricity needs could increase risk of fires.
